definition: lit. not eating for fear of choking (idiom); fig. to cut off one's nose to spite one's face/to avoid sth essential because of a slight risk
cause/reason/because
to choke (on)/to choke up/to suffocate
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
to eat/food/animal feed/eclipse
to feed (a person or animal)

sentences.english: These remarks sound reasonable, yet in fact they are quite illogical.
sentences.chinese: 聽起來有理，其實是個因噎廢食的邏輯。

sentences.english: People won't stop eating just because of the risk of choking.
But to not practice, to not get an injury would be counterproductive.
sentences.chinese: 但爲了躲避傷病而因噎廢食的做法只能是適得其反。

sentences.english: Theirworries and considerations are justified, but we should not give up eating for choking.
sentences.chinese: 他們的擔心和顧慮是正常的，但是我們不能因噎廢食。

sentences.english: However, he said, 'I'm trying to not freak out and just do something.
sentences.chinese: 不過他說，我努力讓自己不要因噎廢食，而是做點事。

sentences.english: But shall we stop eating for fear of choking?
sentences.chinese: 但我們是否該因噎廢食呢？

sentences.english: It sounds reasonable but it is actually a fallacy.
sentences.chinese: 聽起來有些理，其實是個因噎廢食的邏輯。

sentences.english: Though some deaths happened during the training, we should not give up eating for fear of choking.
sentences.chinese: 儘管訓練期間有出現死亡事故，但我們不能因噎廢食。

definition: freedom of the media
to keep on the right side of everyone (idiom)/warm and affable
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)

lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/to remark upon a person's appearance/nitpicking/overcritical/judgmental
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
lit. seeing others go hunting, one is excited by memories of the thrill of the hunt (idiom)/fig. seeing others do what one loves to do, one is inspired to try it again
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
glib of tongue (idiom)/eloquent
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
(not) a single person/(no) one
political climate
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5
